msContents.summary: Tamil version of the Vikramacarita, that is, 32 stories (Tamil katai) about the king Vikrama (Vikkiramātittaṉ) told to king Bhoja by the figurines (Tamil patumai) of his throne.

msItem.title: Vikkiramātittaṉ Patumaikkatai

filiation.p: GOML R. 1972, R. 2244. UVSL, vol. 4, pp. 246-7, No. 2040. TMSSML, vol. 1 , 1925, Nos. 579 and 589.

measure.p: Other folios (4 front and 3 back guard-leaves), not paginated, but some with library foliation.
The volume is thus constituted of
- 1 unfoliated/unpaginated front folio, blank recto and verso

- 1 unpaginated front folio, with Arabic foliation "1" on bottom right edge, bearing, on its recto, in black ink, an access number ("N°14"), the title ("Vicra marken kadey") and a stamp ("BIBLIOTHEQUE ROYALE")
- 1 bound in small paper annotation bearing in black ink the title ("Vikramarken Kadai Tamoul")
- 1 unpaginated front folio, with Arabic foliation "2" on bottom right edge, bearing, on its recto an access number ("Catal. Impr N° XIV") in pencil
- 44 folios, with Tamil pagination 2-89 (first page not explicitly paginated), Arabic foliation 1-46 on top right edge, Arabic foliation 3-47 on bottom right edge, containing the text
- 1 back unpaginated folio, foliated 47 on top right edge, bering on its recto, in black ink, the title ("Vicramarcoum catta") and on its verso a stamp ("BIBLIOTHEQUE ROYALE")
- 1 unpaginated/unfoliated back folio, blank recto and verso

additions.p: Title on the spine: VIKRAMARKEN KADAI TAMOUL.
Title on front folio 3: Vicra marken kadey
Title on paper annotation bound in between front folio 3 and front folio 4: Vikramarken Kadai Tamoul

binding.p: Leather cover, with title on the spine("VIKRAMARKEN KADAI TAMOUL") and heraldic lilies on the spine.

origin.origDate: 1729 at the latest. The stamp “BIBLIOTHEQUE ROYALE” indicates that the codex is an old acquisition. It appears to be the paper Vicramarquen Cadey or Vicramarken Kadey sent by the Pondichéry Missionnaries in 1729, according to lists found in the “Anciens catalogues de la Bibliothèque du Roi … Mémoires de livres et mss. envoyés par les Jésuites de l’Inde pour la Bibliothèque du Roi, en 1729-1735” (BnF NAF 5442). 1750 according to Cabaton (1912, p. 60).

acquisition.p: Ancien fonds XIV. See Catalogus codicum manuscriptorum Bibliothecae regiae, p. 434.
